data.title: Ray.Intersect(Plane) behaves dramatically different from the XNA version
data.body:
I haven't been able to come up with a concrete test case for this yet, but Ray.Intersect(Plane) (and its ref version) behaves really different from the XNA one. The biggest, most obvious issue is that sometimes it returns a non-null negative float in cases where the XNA version would have returned null... for some reason it's finding an intersection behind the Ray?

I've also seen other cases where it just produces incorrect results compared with the MS version.

data.title: Make iOS compile again
data.body: Updated accelerometer and compass to match the android version

data.title: Origin not working properly after #761
data.body:
After pull request #761 our game has gone totally insane with almost all the positions being ####ed up. We draw our graphics with spritebatch.
It seems to me that during the rewrite, something was missed about origins. Our origins are out of place. It feels like the scale was not applied on the origin. Changing the origin from "Origin" to "Origin*scale" seems to correct everything on my iPad, but that's not how it works in XNA.

data.title: Fixed issue #672: Gamepad analogue sticks & Accelerator don't work (PSMobile)
data.body: Initialize GamePadState with values (was initialized without the actual data from the gamepad).

data.title: Fix iOS build
data.body: iOS doesn't currently build, this fixes up the compile errors.

data.title: [iOS] Add MonoTouch 6.0 compatibility
data.body:
I have updated to MonoTouch and encountered a number of issues. It would be great if someone could look into them. Most issues seem to come from the iOS 6.0 itself.
The issues:
- The orientation is always portrait during Initialize. This seems to be some kind of bug which will not be fixed soon. I guess it's related to the new orientation handling.
- GameCenter requires portrait support to function, or otherwise the app crashes.

What's new:
- New orientation handler. Needs a rewrite.
- Lots of API changes, many of the functions we use went obsolete

data.title: Android - textures don't draw after resuming anymore
Compilation broken on PSMobile (can't convert VertexPositionColorTexture to VertexPosition2ColorTexture)
data.body:
Cannot build the PSMobile.sln file.

Getting these errors:

"D:\Projects\OpenSource\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework.PSMobile.sln" (default targ
et) (1) ->
"D:\Projects\OpenSource\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\MonoGame.Framework.PSMobile.csproj" (default target) (3) ->
(CoreCompile target) ->
  PSSuite\Graphics\SpriteBatcher.cs(147,29): error CS0029: Cannot implicitly convert type 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.VertexPositionColorTexture' to Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.VertexPosition2ColorTexture' [D:\Projects\OpenSource\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\MonoGame.Framework.PSMobile.csproj]  PSSuite\Graphics\SpriteBatcher.cs(148,29): error CS0029: Cannot implicitly co
nvert type 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.VertexPositionColorTexture' to 'Mi
crosoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.VertexPosition2ColorTexture' [D:\Projects\OpenSo
urce\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\MonoGame.Framework.PSMobile.csproj]
  PSSuite\Graphics\SpriteBatcher.cs(149,29): error CS0029: Cannot implicitly co
nvert type 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.VertexPositionColorTexture' to 'Mi
crosoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.VertexPosition2ColorTexture' [D:\Projects\OpenSo
urce\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\MonoGame.Framework.PSMobile.csproj]
  PSSuite\Graphics\SpriteBatcher.cs(150,29): error CS0029: Cannot implicitly co
nvert type 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.VertexPositionColorTexture' to 'Mi
crosoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.VertexPosition2ColorTexture' [D:\Projects\OpenSo
urce\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\MonoGame.Framework.PSMobile.csproj]

Seems like SpriteBatcher class internal _vertexArray field was updated to a new type (VertexPosition2ColorTexture) while the SpriteBatchItem fields remain using the older type.

data.title: MonoGame (develop3d branch) does not build on Linux
data.body:
Hi,

I tried to build MonoGame on Linux but I face several issues :
1. The files MGFXShaders.cs Shader.cs and Shader.ogl.cs are referenced in the project butare not in the repository. Then, when I deleted it, seems to be working.
2. Then, when compiling, 
monogame/MonoGame.Framework/Desktop/OpenTKGamePlatform.cs(254,26): error CS1061: Type `OpenTK.GameWindow' does not contain a definition for`CursorVisible' and no extension method `CursorVisible' of type`OpenTK.GameWindow' could be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)
/usr/lib/cli/OpenTK-1.0/OpenTK.dll (Location of the symbol related to previous error)
/home/julien/tmp/monogame/MonoGame.Framework/Desktop/OpenTKGamePlatform.cs(257,32): error CS0117: `OpenTK.Input.Mouse' does not contain a definition for`SetPosition'
/usr/lib/cli/OpenTK-1.0/OpenTK.dll (Location of the symbol related to previous error)

So, I add the reference OpenTk.Compatibility. Seems to work.
1. After, I got some errors related to OpenAL but I do not know how to cope with that. I think there might be some overlap between assemblies and thus, everything fails to build. See the error below.
   monogame/MonoGame.Framework/Linux/Audio/Sound.cs(173,54): error CS0104: `ALFormat' is an ambiguous reference between`OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALFormat' and `OpenTK.Audio.ALFormat'

For information, I am trying to build on Debian sid.

data.title: Android rendering issues resolved
data.body:
- Added GraphicsExtensions.CheckGLError().  Has a Conditional("DEBUG") attribute so it only exists in builds with a DEBUG conditional.
- Added call to GraphicsExtensions.CheckGLError() after every GL call.  Found several problem areas on Android.  Performance in Debug builds does not appear to be affected much, if at all.
- Attribute vertex locations are no longer hard-coded.  Locations are retrieved after linking the shader program.
- Added call to GL.UseProgram() before calls to GL.Uniform1() to prevent InvalidOperation error.
- Retrieve maximum number of texture image units from OpenGL and use that number to initialize TextureCollection and SamplerStates in GraphicsDevice. Prevents error from using out-of-range index in GL.ActiveTexture().

If the fail doesn't repeat it only takes a few minutes to comment out the font usage in the Primitives3D sample and use it to test Mono.

data.title: Android SoundEffectInstance fixes
data.body:
This fixes a few issues with the Android SoundEffect / SoundEffectInstance API. I realise this is cutting it fine for the 3.0 code freeze, so I'll leave it up to the other devs to decide if it's worth adding. 
- Implemented MasterVolume modulation. This just didn't work for Android before.
- Getting the SoundState from SoundEffectInstance will now work for looping sounds a least. The underlying Andriod SoundPool API does not support this, so we rely on the stored state in SoundEffectInstance. One notable change here is that for non-looping sounds, we will always be reporting the state as Playing (even after it's finished) as opposed to always reporting Stopped (even when it's playing). I could change that back if people think it's better to keep previous behaviour for non-looping sounds.
- Playing the same SoundEffect multiple times would result in both instances referencing the last played _streamId, meaning you could never stop the first one if it was looping. To fix this I refactored the _streamId out of the Andriod specific Sound.cs and into SoundEffectInstance.cs. This does make the code messier, but until we get OpenAL, I think it's worth it.
- I also accidentally commited a couple of minor improvements to the ContentTypeReaderManager to this branch. I figured these are worth including though.

data.title: Microsoft.Devices.Sensors implementation for Android (TEST)
data.body:
Implemented Accelerometer and Compass for Android based on Nezz's PR #747 for iOS (included in this branch).
Moved common source files to a common folder.
Implemented proper Dispose pattern.
Fixed some inconsistencies with the MSDN documentation.

data.title: Fixed missing #if OPENGL
data.body: Fixed compile bug from missing #if OPENGL.

data.title: MacOS pitch fix and combined duplicate classes
data.body: Combined MacOS/Audio/SoundEffectInstance.cs and Desktop/Audio/SoundEffectInstance.cs into one seeing as they were almost duplicates and fixes were often done in one and not the other, particularly MacOS was missing the transform of XNA pitch to OpenAL pitch.  Used Murudai's pitch fix (http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/392488) as it more closely matches that which OpenAL would do. iOS was using MacOS/Audio/SoundEffectInstance.cs so it now points to Desktop/Audio/SoundEffectInstance.cs as well.

data.title: Thanks to liortal53 for pointing out this obvious fix that I missed. The...
data.body: ... Draw2D and ChaseAndEvade demos on PlayStation Mobile now work.

data.title: Fix dodgy offset resulting from incorrect viewport on Android
data.body:
Dean noticed that the Draw2D sample was unexpectedly offset. It seems that my recent change to `GraphicsDeviceManager.ResetClientBounds()`, coupled with other recent changes in the `GraphicsDevice.Viewport` setter caused this issue.

Essentially the fix boils down to moving the setting of the Viewport to after the setting of the BackBufferWidth/Height as the GL.Viewport call depends on the buffer size. I've taken the opportunity to comment and slightly clean up the method as it's functionality is not easy to understand at first glance.

data.title: Game Class Support For WinRT XAML

data.body: It's pretty obvious because it throws a NotImplementedException but I thought i'd bring it up because it causes problems on my current project.  I'm attempting to change the resolution by calling Reset with PresentationParameters.
